Notes: Epoch scored as ppt time spent in movement
> 4% decrease in SpO2 with > 30% decrease in flow lasting > 10 seconds (AASM definition)
> 4% decrease in SpO2 with > 30% decrease in flow and partially occluded airway lasting > 10 seconds
> 4% decrease in SpO2 with > 30% decrease in flow and no respiratory effort lasting > 10 seconds
> 4% decrease in SpO2 with both central, then obstructive components lasting > 10 seconds
>90% reduction in thermistor flow lasting > 10 seconds
>90% reduction in thermistor flow with no respiratory effort lasting > 10 seconds
>10 second period containing both obstructive and central components
>90% reduction in thermistor flow lasting > 10 seconds
Period of >10 seconds of increasing respiratory effort leading to arousal
Out of phase thoracic and abdominal effort.
>3 cycles of increasing then decreasing breathing amplitude resulting in apnea
> 3 consecutive beats at >100 BPM with a QRS interval > 120 ms
> 3 consecutive beats at >100 BPM with a QRS interval < 120 ms
Irregularly regular rhythm with no P waves and no consistent waveform
Series of > 4 left leg LMs at 5-90 second intervals
Series of > 4 right leg LMs at 5-90 second intervals
Left leg EMG activity lasting 0.5-10 seconds
Right leg EMG activity lasting 0.5-10 seconds
Esophageal pH measured near the bottom of the esophagus
Esophageal pH measured near the top of the esophagus
Unreliable EtCO2 signal (CO2 measured during expired air)
Unreliable TcCO2 pressure signal (CO2 saturation measured at the skin surface)
